info.title: Localization API
info.description: An API for translating text content into multiple languages

post.description: Translates text content to one or multiple target languages

403.description: Unauthorized to use this src/tgt language

schema.description: The format of the data to be posted.
A unique key/token provided by Reverie to identify the user using the Localization API.
The unique account ID to identify the user and the default account settings.

The language of the input text

 **Available Language Codes:**

 * `hi` : Hindi
 * `en` : English
 * `as` : Assamese
 * `bn` : Bengali
 * `gu` : Gujarati
 * `kn` : Kannada
 * `kok` : Konkani
 * `ml` : Malayalam
 * `mr` : Marathi
 * `mai` : Maithili
 * `or` : Odia
 * `pa` : Punjabi
 * `ta` : Tamil
 * `te` : Telugu
 * `ne` : Nepali
 * `ur` : Urdu

 **Note**: The user is allowed to use only the authorized language codes configured while sharing the REV-APP-ID and REV-API-KEY.

Language to which you want to localize the input text Note- To enter multiple target languages, separate the value using the comma separator(,). For example: “tgt_lang” : “hi, ta”

 **Available Language Codes:**

 * `hi` : Hindi
 * `en` : English
 * `as` : Assamese
 * `bn` : Bengali
 * `gu` : Gujarati
 * `kn` : Kannada
 * `kok` : Konkani
 * `ml` : Malayalam
 * `mr` : Marathi
 * `mai` : Maithili
 * `or` : Odia
 * `pa` : Punjabi
 * `ta` : Tamil
 * `te` : Telugu
 * `ne` : Nepali
 * `ur` : Urdu

 **Note**: The user is allowed to use only the authorized language codes configured while sharing the REV-APP-ID and REV-API-KEY.

The Domain refers to the universe in which you use the Transliteration API. Example - Health Care, Insurance, Legal, etc.

 **Available Domains:**

 * `General`: The default domain. Localizes content irrespective of the domain.
 * `Travel`: Trained for travel industry terminologies.
 * `Ecommerce`: Helps localize content in the Ecommerce domain.
 * `Music`: Trained for Media & Entertainment domain translations.
 * `Banking`: Accurately translates BFSI domain content.
 * `Grocery`: Specially built for grocery industry terminologies.
 * `Education`: Helps translate academic content.
 * `Medical`: Serves the healthcare industry.

 **Note**: Mention the domain ID. Refer to Supporting Domain above for valid domain ID. The default domain 1
The parameter to identify the API.
The version refers to the specific iteration of the API that is being called.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
--url https://revapi.reverieinc.com/localization \
--header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--header 'REV-API-KEY: <YOUR API KEY>' \
--header 'REV-APP-ID: <YOUR APP-ID>' \
--header 'REV-APPNAME: localization' \
--header 'REV-APPVERSION: 3.0' \
--header 'domain: generic' \
--header 'src_lang: en' \
--header 'tgt_lang: hi' \
--data '{
  "data": ["Hello, how are you?"],
  "nmtMask": true,
  "enableNmt": true,
  "enableLookup": false
}'

import requests

url = "https://revapi.reverieinc.com/localization"

headers = {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "REV-API-KEY": "<YOUR API KEY>",
    "REV-APP-ID": "<YOUR APP-ID>",
    "src_lang": "en",
    "tgt_lang": "hi",
    "domain": "generic",
    "REV-APPNAME": "localization",
    "REV-APPVERSION": "3.0"
}

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.text)

package main

import (
  "fmt"
  "net/http"
  "io/ioutil"
)

func main() {
  url := "https://revapi.reverieinc.com/localization"
  req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, nil)
  req.Header.Add("Content-Type", "application/json")
  req.Header.Add("REV-API-KEY", "<YOUR API KEY>")
  req.Header.Add("REV-APP-ID", "<YOUR APP-ID>")
  req.Header.Add("src_lang", "en")
  req.Header.Add("tgt_lang", "hi")
  req.Header.Add("domain", "generic")
  req.Header.Add("REV-APPNAME", "localization")
  req.Header.Add("REV-APPVERSION", "3.0")
  res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)
  defer res.Body.Close()
  body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)
  fmt.Println(string(body))
}

<?php
$curl = curl_init();
curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://revapi.reverieinc.com/localization",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Content-Type: application/json",
    "REV-API-KEY: <YOUR API KEY>",
    "REV-APP-ID: <YOUR APP-ID>",
    "REV-APPNAME: localization",
    "REV-APPVERSION: 3.0",
    "domain: generic",
    "src_lang: en",
    "tgt_lang: hi"
  ],
]);
$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);
curl_close($curl);
if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

data.description: The text you want to translate. This is the input text that will be processed by the translation model.

nmtMask.description:
Determines the Words that are to be masked.

 **Note** - On defining values in the nmtMaskTerms, then automatically the nmtMask is set to true.

 **Example** - Masking a term - `nmtMaskTerms`: [`Reverie Language Technologies`] Here, the API will mask the term Reverie Language Technologies, if found in the source content, and will transliterate the word.
